summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USAO SDNY) requesting and receiving approval for travel related to the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein (case 2018R01618). The emails detail planned trips for victim interviews in Los Angeles, West Palm Beach, Fort Lauderdale, and Stockholm, Sweden, between March 2019 and January 2020.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.context: The recipient of multiple travel approval requests from the investigative team; he grants approval for the travel.

persons.name: Darlene Alleyne
persons.context: Copied on several travel request emails; appears to be part of the legal/prosecutorial team for the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Michele Duncan
persons.context: Copied on travel request emails; part of the legal team conducting the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation, United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618, relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity.

keyFacts: The document reveals ongoing, active investigation into Jeffrey Epstein (case 2018R01618) by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York from at least March 2019 through January 2020.

The investigation involved extensive travel by the prosecutorial team to conduct victim interviews in multiple U.S. cities (Los Angeles, West Palm Beach, Fort Lauderdale) and internationally (Stockholm, Sweden).
Travel requests frequently included plans to reserve hotel conference rooms for conducting interviews, indicating formal interview settings.
The case is formally described as 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618, an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity.'
The email chain shows a standardized internal approval process for investigative travel, with Edward Tyrrell as the consistent approving official.
